result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kelly W. McClone was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders bond to be applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment, unless medically excused by a treating physician.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kelly W. McClone

records.addlTxt:
14CF173, 15CF10,15CF33, 14TR2021, 14TR2023, 15TR337, & 15TR383. Defendant Kelly W. McClone in court with attorney Jonas Bednarek.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on the record. Attorney Bednarek concurs. State moves to withdraw the motion to forfeit bond. Preliminary hearing discussed on all matters. Defedant wishes to waive right to preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing. Court has read the complaints, finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed on each matter. Attorney Bednarek confirms receipt, waives formal reading.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  No Contest to Count 1 of 14CF173. No Contest to Count 1 in 15CF10. No Contest to Count 1 in 15CF33. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright Count 2 of 15CF10 & Count 2 of 15CF33. Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 2 & 3 in 14CF173, Count 2 in 15CF10, Counts 3 & 4 in 15CF33 along with 14TR2021, 14TR2023, 15TR337 & 15TR383. Sentencing argument by Attorney Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Bednarek. Statement by the defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 
14CF173: 9 months WCJ, with Huber but No Good Time Credit. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 1 day credit.

15CF10: 3 years Wisconsin State Prison, to be served as 1 years Initial Confinement & 2 years Extended Supervision. Credit for 6 days. Concurrent to 14CF173. CONDITIONS: $2500 fine inclusive of costs,plus a $42.50 blood draw fee, to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 36 month DL revocation, 36 month IID, OWI assessment. Absolute sobriety, No bars, not to possess/ingest any impairing substances without a valid prescription. Maintain full time employment. Terms of Agent. 

15CF33: 4 years Wisconsin State Prison, to be served as 18 month Initial Confinement and 30 month Extended supervision. Consecutive to 15CF10. Credit for 56 days.  CONDITIONS: $3000 fine inclusive of costs, plus a $42.50 blood draw fee, to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 36 month DL revocation, 36 month IID, OWI assessment. Absolute sobriety, No bars, not to possess/ingest any impairing substances without a valid prescription. Maintain full time employment. Terms of Agent. Appeal Rights Given.
from Atty Bednarek - supplement to the arguments to be made on the record at plea/sentencing hearing

2:42 pm cases called. 14CF173, 15CF10, 15CF33, 14TR2021, 14TR2023, 15TR337 & 15TR383.  Defendant Kelly W. McClone in court with attorney Jonas Bednarek.  Defendant Kelly W. McClone in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. P/S scheduled-NOH given.
Status conference on March 18, 2015 at 01:35 pm.

The court will hold in abeyance determination on the motion to forfeit bond which will track along with the proceedings. 15CF10- Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. The court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 01:35 pm.

Case Called @ 1:17 PM: Defendant Kelly W. Mcclone in court, in custody, appearing via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel, states he has spoken with counsel - Atty Jonas Bednarek.  States he will be retaining Atty Bendarek as to this matter also.  ADA argues as to bond - $3000 cash with conditions.  No statement as to bond by Def.  The Court:  Orders $3000 cash bond w/conditions as requested.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
